item.title: go: tell me about slow channels
item.author: aron.atkins@gmail.com (Aron Atkins)
item.description: Go channels are a powerful construct for passing information between different go routines, each with distinct responsibilities. Writing to an unbuffered channel is a blocking operation which does not complete until a reader is available at the other end. The blocked write is not guaranteed to complete – if the channel responsible for the read is somehow blocked itself, you may have deadlock. Here is a simple wrapper around a channel write that helps detect long-blocked operations.
